thread.title: Former Alabama teammates react to Altee Tenpenny's death
thread.title_full: Former Alabama teammates react to Altee Tenpenny's death

author: Michael Casagrande | mcasagrande@al.com
title: Former Alabama teammates react to Altee Tenpenny's death
text:
Comments 
The news of former Alabama running back Altee Tenpenny's death stunned ex-teammates back in Tuscaloosa. 
Crimson Tide players first reacted just before midnight on Twitter, well before the story was confirmed later Wednesday morning. Tenpenny was traveling home to North Little Rock, Ark., after being dismissed from the Nicholls State football team in Thibodaux, La. The wreck occurred at approximately 5 p.m. near Glen Allan, Miss. 
RELATED: Details emerge in Altee Tenpenny's death in one-car accident 
Tenpenny transferred from Alabama in January after two seasons as a reserve running back. He landed at UNLV, then Nicholls State in August. 
Current and former Alabama players expressed shock and shared memories of Tenpenny on Twitter and Instagram. Kenyan Drake posted a long message about his former teammate under his picture on Instagram: A photo posted by Kenyan Drake (@roadrun17er) on Oct 21, 2015 at 7:21am PDT Everytime 28 would see me he would get in a DB stance and start back pedaling and say "let me get in them drills with u big bra" — John Fulton (@_Elvis_Freshley) October 21, 2015 Just the funniest dude, who ALWAYS had a joke and a smile on his face #RIPAltee — John Fulton (@_Elvis_Freshley) October 21, 2015 I love you bruh , from the bottom of my heart & your name will always live through me . 👼🏾🅰28🐘🏈 pic.twitter.com/mEHPYBEJ3V — Derrick Henry  (@KingHenry_2) October 21, 2015 R.I.P Altee..man gone to soon..I'll always remember you calling me big bro I can't wait to be on your level... I love you man...God Bless💯 — LANDON COLLINS (@TheHumble_21) October 21, 2015 Altee had the biggest smile, you couldn't miss it. I'll never forget the talks we had, bro came to my room almost everyday smh life's crazy. — R.I.P Freddy G (@AmariCooper9) October 21, 2015 RIP Altee Tenpenny pic.twitter.com/sHcm1nGWYt — Cody Mandell (@CodyMandell29) October 21, 2015 R.I.P Altee
